alert.note: Alert for Coachella Valley; Riverside County Mountains; San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 2:41PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside and northeastern San Diego Counties through 330 PM PDT... At 239 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Hwy 74 Between Anza And Palm Desert, or 16 miles southwest of Coachella, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Santa Rosa mountains hiking and camping. Locations impacted include... Borrego Springs, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Anza, Julian, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Ranchita, Hwy 79 Between Warner Springs And Oak Grove, Hwy 79 Between Santa Ysabel And Warner Springs, Lake Henshaw, Hwy S22 Between Ranchita And Borrego Springs, Borrego Palm Canyon, Hwy 74 Between Anza And Palm Desert, Warner Springs, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy 74 Between Mountain Center And Anza, La Quinta and Santa Rosa Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coachella Valley; Riverside County Mountains; San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains
